intro: Geigeria wellmanii, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Geigeria wellmanii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
